title: Musicians Seek Residual Payments From Streamed Programs
text:
Musicians behind the soundtracks to hits like “The Handmaid’s Tale” and “The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel” are seeking better pay from films and TV shows that go directly to streaming services.

American Federation of Musicians, a union representing players in orchestras and film and television studio productions, on Monday began contract negotiations with the Alliance of Motion Picture and Television Producers. It represents studios including Walt Disney Co., AT&T Inc.’s Warner Bros. and Sony Corp’s Sony Pictures.

...
